fields.description:
Document changes for MidoNet v5 support.

Remove tomcat

See https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/NET/MidoNet+5.x

Existing Mido install docs - 
http://builds.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/branch/master/#install-guide/install_midokura.html - overview / section level
http://builds.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/branch/master/#install-guide/install_midokura_installation.html - *existing installation section that needs tomcat removed and requires further updates per [~tsugawa]*

comments.body:
[~tsugawa] in DOC-2002, [~mbacchi] (or maybe you) said: "Replace 'Tomcat' with 'MidoNet-API' in all figures."

However, reading the [wiki|https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/NET/MidoNet+5.x]: "MidoNet-API in MN 1.9 series has been replaced by MidoNet Cluster. This means that tomcat is not a dependency for MN5."

So I believe I should be replacing "MidoNet API (tomcat)" in all the figures with "MidoNet Cluster" instead? Please confirm.

Example figures: https://docs.eucalyptus.com/eucalyptus/latest/#install-guide/preparing_vpc_midonet.html

btw - do you know where Scott got these figures originally [~tsugawa]?

[~tsugawa] should I replace the "Install the MidoNet API on the Cloud Controller (CLC)" section about tomcat / MidoNet-API here: https://docs.eucalyptus.com/eucalyptus/latest/#install-guide/install_midokura_installation.html

... with the steps for installing MidoNet Cluster here: https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/NET/MidoNet+5.x ?

Technically, midonet-cluster is not a replacement of Tomcat. midonet-cluster does implement MidoNet API, but it has other roles in MidoNet. Replacing "MidoNet API (tomcat)" with "MidoNet API (midonet-cluster)" is OK if it is clear in the text that midonet-cluster is not a replacement of tomcat. In MEM v1.9 MidoNet API was implemented as a tomcat webapp, while in MEM v5.x, MidoNet API is implemented within midonet-cluster - I hope this subtle difference is clear.

the figures...
They are from https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/x/pwAmBQ
Please note the "DRAFT" in the title of the wiki page. The page was "integrated" into Eucalyptus docs without much editing and figure beautification. Once again, the wiki page is a DRAFT.
Minor updates for MidoNet v5 at https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/x/f6sTCg

MEM installation will need to be fully revised - https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/NET/MidoNet+5.x is not complete. It can be used as a reference, but I believe there are additional steps not in this wiki. Installation docs are based on calyptos, so perhaps [~mbacchi] could help?
[~mbacchi] let's talk tomorrow about the above comments. thanks!

Removed tomcat references in text and graphics. (TODO http://builds.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/branch/master/#install-guide/install_midokura_installation.html update for v5.2 - will work with [~mbacchi])

[~tony] just added links to the existing Mido install docs in this ticket's description - please review them and the above comments. Please help me with updating/correcting install instructions. Very much appreciate your help to find the SMEs and make a plan to update.

[~tsugawa], [~tony] asks good questions about http://builds.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/branch/master/#install-guide/install_midokura_prereqs.html - prereqs - 
•	for Repository Access section, why have an example and just not point to Mido docs like is done for Zookeeper and cassandra sections?
•	Why have any zookeeper steps in this doc and not solely point to mido docs? 
•	Cassandra section. Rather than pointing to official docs from Datastax then in the next section pointing to mido cassandra, why not just point to mido cassandra setup.

For consistency and easy docs management, it makes sense to just point to Midokura docs.

Having a copy of Midokura docs in Euca may help some users that prefer a single document to follow. But, again, it is more work to maintain Euca documentations in sync with Midokura.

Thanks - the usual method is to point to 3rd party software docs, not rewrite, unless we do something very specific/different. I do like the way this section points out how there are 3 services to install.

More feedback from [~tony] - 
https://docs.eucalyptus.com/eucalyptus/latest/#install-guide/install_midokura_installation.html
•	No longer install or configure tomcat, Mido 5 uses midonet-cluster this entire section should change

step: install packages
yum install midonet-cluster python-midonetclient

step: edit conf file: /etc/midonet/midonet.conf add zookeeper host IP
[zookeeper]
zookeeper_hosts = <ZK HOST IP>:2181

step: configure access to NSDB:
cat << EOF | mn-conf set -t default
zookeeper {
    zookeeper_hosts = “<ZK HOST>:2181"
}

cassandra {
    servers = “<CASS HOST>"
}
EOF

step: Enable and start service:
systemctl enable midonet-cluster.service
systemctl start midonet-cluster.service

________________________________________
Install midolman section

•	Don’t need to upgrade kernel (thus no reboot either)
•	Do not need to install iproute
•	Step 5 was done in the cassandra setup steps and can be removed

Updated content based on [~tony] input plus https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=NET&title=MEM+v1.9+to+MEM+v5.2+upgrade+notes - wondering about rest_api param step and order of steps - please confirm!

http://builds.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/branch/master/index.html#install-guide/install_midokura_prereqs.html
http://builds.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/branch/master/index.html#install-guide/install_midokura_installation.html

Edit suggestions:

Since the following is a quote from MidoNet docs, it would be good to have a reference.
"The MidoNet Cluster is a type of node introduced in MidoNet v5 that replaces the MidoNet API. The MidoNet Cluster provides the REST API endpoint, and also hosts a number of management services such as VxLAN Gateway Controller." (see http://docs.midokura.com/docs/v5.2/en/reference-architecture/content/midonet_cluster.html)

Personally, I would prefer something like:
MidoNet management services provide means to manage MidoNet functions that MidoNet agents (midolman) are unable to perform on their own. The so called MidoNet Cluster services include state synchronization of VxLAN gateways and the MidoNet REST API. A MidoNet v5 deployment requires at least one MidoNet cluster node, and since it replaces the MidoNet API webapp (which was hosted by tomcat in MidoNet v1 series), it must be co-located with the CLC in Eucalyptus deployments. For security reasons, MidoNet REST API is accessed only on CLC (localhost interface).

I don't think the following statement is accurate:
"In MidoNet, a tunnel zone groups hosts together for use as a software-defined network (SDN)."

Suggestion:
In MidoNet, a tunnel zone is an isolation zone for hosts (see http://docs.midokura.com/docs/v5.2/en/operations-guide/content/tunnel_zones.html). Physical hosts that are members of a given tunnel zone communicate directly with one another and establish network tunnels as needed on demand. These network tunnels are used to transport overlay traffic (e.g., inter-VM communication) and isolate the underlay physical network communication (i.e., inter-physical hosts communication). On an Eucalyptus deployment, one MidoNet tunnel zone is expected with the IP address on the physical network designated to carry VM traffic being used when configuring its members. Eucalyptus accepts the following tunnel zone names:
- eucatz
- euca-tz
- midotz
- mido-tz

Thank you [~tsugawa]. Will work on the above edits.

Can you verify this: wondering about rest_api param step and order of steps - please confirm! (wiki has api param steps, and a different order of steps) for this page: http://builds.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/branch/master/index.html#install-guide/install_midokura_installation.html
(start/enable, set api param, restart = correct order?)

[~kmeredith] I think both wiki and the current docs steps are consistent - enable/start; set param; restart.

Last time I tested, midonet-cluster had to be running in order to change the parameters. so start-change-restart is the right sequence. I don't think we can shorten to set parameters - enable/start. Not sure which sequence you are referring, though.
Thanks, [~tsugawa] that was exactly the question. And I like answers that mean I don't have to change it. :)

[~tsugawa] updated per your comments above. Please ensure my text editing did not change the technical facts.
http://builds.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/branch/master/index.html#install-guide/install_midokura_installation.html

One thing that looks questionable, a leftover from pre-4.4 release docs, on the .conf file update for zookeeper_host_IP: 
{code}root_key = /midonet/v1{code}
... in the Midolman install topic, step 1. Should I delete or keep that bit?

"root_key" is not needed and should be removed.

In the MidoNet Cluster description, I am not sure if it is clear that "MidoNet management services" == "MidoNet Cluster services", or conveys that MidoNet Cluster services provide MidoNet management services.

One way to fix would be to just use MidoNet Cluster services:
MidoNet Cluster services provide a means to ... instead of "MidoNet management services provide a means to"

All updates published https://docs.eucalyptus.com/eucalyptus/latest/#install-guide/install_midokura_installation.html

[~tsugawa], thank you, let me know if you see any other issues.
